abstract: The publisher will team with the Web site RealClearPolitics to release a series of campaign-related e-books.
snippet: The publisher will team with the Web site RealClearPolitics to release a series of campaign-related e-books.
lead_paragraph: Random House is expanding its publishing efforts tied to the 2012 election by teaming up with RealClearPolitics, a political Web site, to release a series of e-books during the campaign, the publisher said today. Crown Publishers, part of Random House, said it would publish three short-form e-book originals, plus one full-length book, beginning Nov. 4. The books will be written by Thomas Bevan, co-founder and executive editor of RealClearPolitics, and Carl M. Cannon, the Washington editor for RealClearPolitics. The first e-book, "Election 2012," is expected to cost $1.99.

headline.main: Random House in Joint Effort on Politics
